answers.answer: I was 4 weeks agead, my husband and his brother are very large men. My son was born at 10.7, and I had an ocean of amniotic fluid, tmi sorry. Maybe your just having a big boy, my son came at 39w3d and was born via csection cause he got stuck and I wasn't dilating.

So with my 2nd baby, i measured 4-5 weeks ahead from 28 weeks on up. They did growth ultrasounds like every 2 weeks and just explained he was a big boy.  I ended up being induced at 36 weeks due to pain I was experiencing from an ovarian cyst. My son was born an 8 lb preemie. :)

Don't worry.  I measured ahead for all 6 of mine, measurements go back down to normal range when they start dropping into the pelvis. My largest was 9 lb 6 oz and ranged down to 7lb 10 oz. All were healthy, none went over or came real late. No gestational diabetes or complications for any either...just  6 foot tall daddy and a mommy with big babies :)
I measured 3 weeks ahead with my daughter and she was actually 2 weeks late. She weighed 8 lbs 3 oz. No problems at all

I am glad I'm not alone! I was a little shocked and secretly excited that he may come earlier than 40 weeks! But, I am very scared of having a baby that's too big for me to push.I am 5'9" and my husband is 6'5".  I also have a very long torso, even for my height. My first child was a girl, came 6 days early, and was just shy of 9 lbs. This is my first child with my husband though, so I don't know what to expect! Just starting to get a little nervous since I've been worried about size my whole pregnancy. This just confirms my fears!

I am measuring five weeks ahead also. My nurse practitioner didn't seem too concerned. I am terrified of having a big baby. My last were 5.12 and 7lbs. I don't have gestational diabetes or excess fluid. I am only 5ft.maybe if you're shorter you carry bigger..I dunno! Lol

question: Okay. So my husband and I are very tall people, and I always knew I would have big babies.I went to my 30 week appointment today and my fundal height measured in at 35 cm, which is on point for someone who is 35 weeks pregnant, but obviouspy way to big for me! I have not had extreme weight gain, I am not over weight, I do not have gestational diabetes, or anything! I am going back in two weeks and giving my measurements one more shot. If they are still way off I will be having a growth ultrasound to check on baby boy.My question is, has anyone else dealt with this, and what happened? Did your baby come early? Did they have to induce you?
title: Fundal Height 5 Weeks Off?
